column5: Looking to switch to a new camp next year. Any ideas? we like to fish for walleye, smallies, northern, muskie, and lake trout. we don't like long boat rides. we need guides in our boats, but like to cook our own meals( steak..etc) . price not an issue. hate flyins with little uncomfortable boats. lastly would like it to be a drive to camp..any ideas...help
http://www.maynardlake.com/http://www.nielsensflyinlodge.com/http://www.allenscrowlakelodge.com/First two are fly-in lodges, but they have nice boats.
check out Gowbushkon Lodge. Has all the fish you want except muskie. Great boats and comfortable cabins at reasonable rates.

Look at Vermilion Bay Lodge........Eagle Lake offers every species you listed including perch and whitefish. Guides are available if you want one and it is a drive in housekeeping lodge . They also offer 18' upgrade boats with trolling motors and fish finders for a reasonable weekly price. Heading there this weekend. Best of luck on finding a great place for your trip next year. PjShorthorn

There are many lodges that will probably fill your wish list. For my money we go to Birch Dale Lodge on Eagle Lake. Eagle has all fish species all a short boat ride from the lodge. The boats are good size most with 40 or 50 hp on. They have a steak house, bar and a camp fish fry one night during the week. We will be making our 8th trip there in a 3 weeks Check out there web site or give Marcel a call he will take great care of you.
X2 what Danbear said about Birch Dale Lodge www.birchdalelodge.com 807-227-5262. I'm heading up there the end of August for my 27th year!!!
http://www.canadafish.com Moose horn lodge - great guides and fishing on Lac Seul! ask for Colin or Ben.
